Any analytical activity depends on reliable and accessible data, and we are proud to be a critical information resource for decision-makers around the world.

Responsibilities: This role is responsible for gathering and summarising Foreign Direct Investments (FDI) information and updating databases that are made available online to subscribers. You will be assigned a geographical coverage area or area of specialism where you will search and document information on foreign direct investment, including but not limited to type of investment, value of investments, number of jobs built by investment, motivation and incentive provided for investment, sources, status and dates. While the role may include client queries assigned to you by your manager, this is not a client facing role.

  • Maintain and add real-time investment news into our FDI historical database via our internal software.
  • With the help of an aggregated news service and via primary internet research you will download, research, prioritise and process all news articles relating to your area/specialism.
  • Improve existing processes and procedures to enhance the speed and accuracy of our product.
  • Expand existing data offering with additional economic or demographic statistics about a geography or area (indicators) and new sources of data
  • Build and update documentation, such as internal procedures, news collection methods, definitions, and news articles download process, to ensure standardisation of data.
  • Maintain efficiency standards by efficient individual timekeeping and following research processes
  • Maintain quality standards by supplying to peer – to – peer checking procedures.

Qualifications :

  • Business proficiency in English. Any additional languages are an advantage
  • Bachelor or advanced degree in business, economics, finance, statistics, or related fields preferred
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite (word, outlook, excel etc)
  • Good organization, attention to detail, problem solving
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Ability to multi-task and adapt to shifting priorities

The Global Middle Office (GMO) provides transaction management support, workflow coordination, rating desk services, and other broad operational support to Moody’s Investors Service’s Rating teams. The department works closely with the lines of business to improve both business process and data quality across the rating lifecycle. The GMO has over 100 employees in 5 countries and is a key player in business process development, new company wide initiatives, and technology projects.

The day-to-day responsibilities of this role are largely focused around data entry and data maintenance tasks. 
As a Financial Data Associate in the Global Middle Office, you will work closely with Credit Analysts in various business lines and geographies as well as other GMO team members to ensure credit rating actions are published and disseminated in a timely fashion while ensuring compliance with global regulatory requirements and internal control processes. As part of this role, you will initiate credit rating actions utilizing various systems, validate the accuracy and timeliness of information and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for application of global regulatory controls (e.g., Dodd-Frank) and internal credit policy requirements are adhered to across the end-to-end credit ratings process
  • Create and prepare rating actions while ensuring accuracy and completeness of credit rating packages
  • Validate accuracy and consistency of financial information included in press releases, credit opinions, and other published documentation.  
  • Review documentation and information sources to ensure organizations, debts, sales, deals, and credit rating actions are accurately reflected in various systems/databases
  • Assess credit rating action publications for compliance with local regulatory requirements, accuracy in credit rating information, and appropriate disclosuresPublish credit rating action press releases to Moody’s websites and global financial publication networks
  • Monitor progress of various activities to ensure timeliness of information publication
  • Develop deep knowledge of rating assignment process
  • Continue to develop knowledge of financial instruments, policy, credit rating methodology updates, and any related business practices
  • Other responsibilities as assigned by management

 

Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate/first-level degree (e.g., Bachelor’s degree)
  • Experience with debt capital markets would be an advantage (e.g., coursework and/or relevant work experience) with prior experience of financial/legal document review.
  • Solid verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills
  • Willing to accept new challenges and demonstrate flexibility with last minute changes in commitments and deadlines and has ability to prioritize tasks accordingly
  • Demonstrates strong knowledge of Microsoft programs including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Role/Responsibilities:
This role is responsible for working with other sales colleagues and other internal stakeholders to drive the sales process for a set of products or services.  Key activities include identifying and qualifying prospects, initiating new sales activity and managing sales cycles to closure. Additionally, the role requires the assessment of client needs and providing clients with strategic guidance and product overviews.


Responsibilities:

  • Meet or exceed annual sales goals and targets that align with the company’s vision and objectives.
  • Responsible for existing relationships with customers for our CreditView (moodys.com) research solution.
  • Work with sales colleagues and other internal stakeholders to drive the sales process from beginning to end by identifying and qualifying prospects, initiating new sales activity and managing sales cycles to closure.

  • Identify additional products and services that clients may benefit from and introduce them appropriately into dialogue with clients.
  • Begin development as a market expert and provide product/service use cases during the sales cycle.
  • Serve as the main liaison between the client service team, the client and the implementation services organization on each services opportunity.
  • Coordinate Moody's Analytics responses to requests for product and services information from prospects and clients.

  • Provide current forecasts and pipeline information to management.
  • Position requires travel to Malaysia, Indonesia and Brunei (25%-50%).


Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate/first-level degree (e.g., Bachelor’s degree) required, with coursework in business, economics, finance, marketing or related fields.
  • 3+ years’ experience working in direct business-to-business sales roles with a focus on serving financial services and/or corporate treasury customers.

job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

A Moody’s Analytics Solution Specialist is a client-facing product expert who interprets customer needs in order to align their objectives and business requirements with Moody's Analytics products’ capabilities and value. This responsibility is accomplished by rigorously researching all relevant details regarding the Moody’s solution you are assigned to, understanding market place trends, conducting live product demonstrations via web or in-person, and by providing relevant collateral to support sales strategies.

 

Working in conjunction with a frontline sales team, this Solution Specialist position will actively manage the product evaluation stage of prospective clients for Moody’s Analytics generative artificial intelligence Research Assistant product. The Solution Specialist will serve as a technical advisor for Research Assistant and be expected to understand the technology that makes Gen AI possible, the corpus of Moody’s research and data encoded in the model, and the use cases thereof. 

 

Solutions Specialists are responsible for understanding customer needs with regards to credit risk analysis including the role and purpose of Moody’s ratings in the capital markets and the methodologies used by Moody’s for its credit ratings. This position will rely heavily on effective communication and social skills that are necessary to prepare, present, and successfully promote the sale of Moody’s credit research solutions. 
As an expert in Moody's Analytics credit research content, you will assist with customer facing demonstrations, proposals, and sales cycles by clearly articulating product benefits, functionality, and the potential to improve customer efficiency. You will also be responsible for interfacing with product managers, developers, and client service teams in order to transmit feedback between customers and product designers.
  

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Understand prevailing trends and best practices in generative artificial intelligence.
  • Demonstrate subject matter expertise regarding Moody’s role in the capital markets in multiple asset classes including, but not limited to corporate, financial institution, municipal, sovereign, and structured finance.
  • Conduct in-depth presentations and demonstrations related to Moody's Analytics Research Assistant product offerings. 
  • Participate in customer facing meetings to determine customer business requirements and align selling strategies.
  • Gain customer acceptance of Moody’s Analytics products by explaining and/or demonstrating product capabilities and benefits.
  • Work closely with the frontline sales team on proposals, Requests for Proposal (RFPs), and Requests for Information (RFIs) responses.
  • Document market feedback regarding product experience and desired enhancements and communicate these findings to the product management and development team.

 

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Banking, Accounting, Business Administration, or similar field. 
  • Minimum of 5-8 years of experience in commercial credit analysis, or capital markets experience.
  • Strategic and analytical individual who is able to recognize market opportunities. 
  • Understanding of fundamental credit analysis.
  • Understanding of generative artificial intelligence.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills including ability to listen to requirements and business problems in order to respond with the appropriate business answer.
  • Comfort working in a high-pressure deadline-oriented environment.
  • Ability to work productively and cooperatively in a structured team environment. 
  • Experience with complex sales cycles is a plus.
  • Experience with modeling or coding is a plus.
  • Public speaking experience is a plus.
  • Ability to travel up to 50%

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Role/Responsibilities :

Within the framework of enlarging our client base and increasing product penetration among our clients, you will be responsible for managing overall client relationships by leading with insights, conveying a vision and steering Moody’s solutions strategically for broad enterprise-wide adoption.  Moody’s Analytics sales force is organized to emphasize a team sales culture. Relationship Managers are charged with defining and executing their portfolio business plan, as well as proactively leading sales strategies, which includes leading a team of Sales Reps and Solutions Specialists, Finance and Legal representatives to articulate and demonstrate Moody’s Analytics’ value proposition in the context of our Clients’ needs. 

As a RM, you will be expected to find new opportunities within the strategic account(s) assigned, direct other sales reps, and lead contract negotiations on behalf of Moody’s Analytics. You are responsible for overall account management within a defined portfolio of clients and you will be expecting to work closely with the counterpart in other region to ensure a cohesive and strategic planning of the account as a whole.  Strategic accounts consist of some of the largest Tier 1 foreign banks, Asset Managers, insurance agencies & Corporate.  RMs are responsible for retaining and growing existing revenue streams with a strong focus on cross-selling and upselling the Moody’s Analytics suite of solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Grow relationships strategically covering a defined portfolio with senior client stakeholders at Board and C Suite-Level.
  • Convey the Moody’s Analytics value proposition, and deliver on sales targets for both new and recurring revenue through a combination of:
    •  Excellent C-level relationship & client engagement
    •  Selling additional services to existing clients
    •  Selling new products and solutions
    • Re-inforce value proposition to retain and grow client relationships
    • Significant meeting activities
    •  Leading, advancing, and negotiating sales to closing
  • Maintain high level of product knowledge
  • Gain and maintain familiarity with client organization and processes to help direct them towards the appropriate Moody’s solution set
  • Manage sales cycles using coordination and communication skills to involve sales specialist where appropriate
  • Provide current forecasts and pipeline information to management
  • Introduce leads to other business units where appropriate

 

 

Qualifications :

  • Bachelor’s degree required. Specialization not necessary but candidate with banking, economics, risk and finance knowledge/experience will have good advantage
  • Minimum 10 years of sales and/or relationship management experience, preferably within the financial services sector. Have local markets knowledge and senior stakeholders connections in APAC countries.
  • Proven track record of sales capability
  • A credit or capital markets background would be preferred but not required
  • Experience working within or selling into financial institution. Solid demonstrated understanding of the financial institution
  • Ability to identify opportunities to cross-sell Moody’s products and solutions
  • Ability to sell on a needs/solutions approach
  • Ability to close deals effectively in a timely manner
  • Ability to work independently while also demonstrating excellent team-working skills
  • High level of commitment
  • Excellent communication skills, including listening skills
  • Excellent senior client stakeholders relationship building, inter-personal and organizational skills are a prerequisite
  • Planning and organizational skills
  • Willingness to travel within assigned region approximately 30% of the time.

job.title: AMD-Head of Relationship Mgmt
job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

The Role / Responsibilities:

 

We are looking for a Head of Relationship Management, Financial Institutions US. The Head of Relationship Management, AMD, Financial Institutions US, is a leadership position that oversees the US Financial Institutions group within the Relationship Management (RM) team. This role is pivotal in maintaining and expanding our business in the US, with a primary focus on Wholesale banks, Insurance companies, Security Firms, FinTechs, and 2nd tier Asset Management firms. Though the primary focus of the team is on selling credit rating products, there is a strong emphasis on positioning MIS as the thought leader in evolving risk areas, like ESG, Cyber, Digital Finance.

The holder of this position is expected to lead the team in achieving commercial targets, positioning MIS as the Agency of Choice, optimizing the organizational structure, and implementing strategic sales & marketing plans. The role involves close collaboration with other groups within Relationship Management and the wider Commercial Group, such as Marketing, Pricing, Products, Sales Enablement, and Operations. A significant part of the role also involves traveling to meet customers, facilitating events, and providing valuable feedback (Voice of the Customer) to different teams.

 

Key responsibilities include:

  • Leadership: Overall line management of the US Financial Institutions group (Wholesale banks, Insurance companies, Security Firms, FinTechs, and 2nd tier Asset Management firms)
    within the US RM team. Lead and support efforts to attract, train, and retain talented staff while optimizing efficiency and effectiveness of the team. 
  • Market Analysis: Continuously monitor the market landscape and competitive environment to identify business opportunities, threats, and market trends.
  • Planning and Execution: Develop and execute on effective sales & marketing, as well as individual account management plans. Develop and implement a variety of new business initiatives and implement best practices in sales techniques to achieve the commercial targets for the team.
  • Achieving Performance Metrics: Achieve and track key performance metrics for the sales team, including meeting sales targets, customer acquisition rates, customer retention rates, and customer satisfaction scores (NPS).
  • Representing the Voice of the Customer: Provide feedback on product needs, ideas, and concepts to the Product Management team where appropriate. Provide feedback on customer service levels and transparency to other parts of the MIS organization. Work closely, where appropriate with other parts of the wider Moody’s Corporation.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with other RM teams in the US, Sales Enablement, Marketing, Pricing, and Operations groups to ensure alignment of strategies and to leverage cross-functional capabilities.
  • External Spokesperson: Act as facilitator of events, such as roundtables and conferences; act as Commercial speaker at conferences and other events.
  • Planning: Lead review of team budget, forecast, and staffing needs for the team.  
  • Outreach and Travel: Expected to spend up to 30% of the time on the road meeting customers and key stakeholders, like industry associations.  

 

Capabilities:

  • Experience: Proven experience in a leadership role within the financial services sector, preferably with a focus on relationship management or sales. Experience with Wholesale banks, Insurance companies, Security Firms, FinTechs, and 2nd tier Asset Management firms would be advantageous. Previous experience in managing a team and achieving commercial targets is essential.
  • Knowledge: Comprehensive understanding of the financial institutions landscape in the US, including market trends, competitive environment, and potential threats. Familiarity with evolving risk areas, like ESG, Cyber, and Digital Finance, would be beneficial.
  • Skills:
    • Strong leadership and team management skills, including the ability to attract, train, and retain talented staff.
    • Excellent strategic planning and execution skills, with a proven ability to develop and implement effective sales & marketing strategies.
    • Strong cross-functional collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with other teams within the organization
    • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to act as a spokesperson at events and conferences. Ability to effectively represent the voice of the customer within the organization
    • Excellent negotiation and influencing skills. Ability to effectively and eloquently chair several meetings daily with customers and intermediaries across a large range of different profiles on short notice or with little preparation
  • Technology Proficiency: Familiarity with Salesforce, data analysis tools (like Excel or Tableau), and virtual communication platforms (like Zoom or Microsoft Teams). Experience with application of GenAI and Digital Finance are preferable.
  • Experience with Regulatory Compliance: Experience with specific regulatory environments (like Dodd-Frank, Basel III, or GDPR) desired. At minimum, evidence of sensitivity to work in a regulated environment. Ability to identify, articulate and manage business risks.
  • Travel: Willingness and ability to travel up to 30% of the time to meet customers and key stakeholders.

 

Academic Qualifications / Work Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, or a related field is typically required. Advanced degrees or professional certifications such as an MBA or CFA may be preferred Minimum of Undergraduate degree preferably in finance, accounting, business or economics. Graduate degree desirable.
  • 10+ years of experience in the financial services industry, alternatively strong transferable skills from another industry. Experience in a management position in a sales, business development and/or client relationship role is essential.
  • Expert level knowledge of key characteristics and dynamics of capital and credit markets.

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is  $224,600 to $325,700, depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. This range is based on a full-time position. In addition to base salary, this role is eligible for incentive compensation. Moody’s also offers a competitive benefits package, including not but limited to medical, dental, vision, parental leave, paid time off, a 401(k) plan with employee and company contribution opportunities, life, disability, and accident insurance, a discounted employee stock purchase plan, and tuition reimbursement.

job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

Description

The Rating Associate will work with lead analysts in assigning and monitoring credit ratings; researching, drafting, and publishing research; and other activities. The Rating Associate will perform an evaluation of credit risk by integrating credit risk inputs prepared by internal and external parties.  In conducting credit analysis for their assigned credits, transactions, or credit reviews. The Rating Associate are expected to participate in rating committee discussions and interact with issuers and other market participants, in collaboration with lead analysts.

The Rating Associate role is integral to Moody’s focus on ratings accuracy, research, and market outreach.  The Rating Associate role will typically focus primarily on one rating group, with the potential for cross-training in and/or work for other rating groups.

Responsibilities

Portfolio Management & Credit Quality
Working with lead analysts by performing day-to-day credit analysis related to ratings, research, presentations, and investor outreach.  Examples of analytical work may include:

  • Reviewing financial spreadsheets and charts, analyzing data and financial statements, building and updating financial forecasts, and writing analytical commentary in accordance with Moody’s methodologies.
  • Assisting with proprietary models and new financial projections as applicable, identifying trends in data, and applying analytical skills and judgment to form well-reasoned credit conclusions.
  • Developing a working knowledge of credit fundamentals through a review of components such as transaction documentation, cash flow analysis, or loss allocation rules.
  • Performing analytical tasks related to portfolio reviews and other credit projects.
  • Developing a working knowledge of Moody’s methodologies and credit rating best practices, and applying these with guidance from lead analysts.
  • Collaborating with lead analysts in preparing the first draft of rating committee memos.
  • Developing the ability to understand and identify key factors that affect issuer credit ratings.  Interpreting and analyzing financial data and other credit inputs provided by internal and external parties.
  • Monitoring credit quality and issuer and/or industry trends by following market developments and relevant news events, analyzing issuer reporting (including, in some rating groups monitoring and attending earnings calls), and engaging with issuers directly for follow-up clarification and information.
  • Attending and participating in rating committee meetings, including to offer analysis and opinion where appropriate. Preparing credit estimates analysis used to assess elements of credit risk in certain rated transactions.

Research, Investor Outreach & Market Interaction

  • Contributing to the first draft of core research (such as credit opinions, issuer and sector comments, press releases, pre-sale, and new issue reports) in collaboration with lead analysts.
  • Contributing to research strategy, including idea generation and preliminary drafting, and adhering to Moody’s research standards.
  • Attending investor briefings and issuer meetings as required; helping prepare presentation materials in some cases; arriving prepared to engage in discussions.
  • Building positive relationships with issuers displaying initiative to understand the issuer’s business and proactively responding to issuer inquiries.

Credit Administration

  • Operating applicable ratings and research systems and utilizing software specific to the rating group.
  • Demonstrating sound understanding and judgment in applying Moody’s processes, documentation standards, and best practices, and adhering to all laws and policies.

Coaching & Guidance

  • Providing guidance in the delegation of work to the data processing team.
  • Actively managing workload pipeline to provide sufficient time for completion.  Seeking guidance from the manager where needed to determine how to prioritize work.
  • Providing feedback to the manager on the quality and accuracy of work produced by the data processing team, while providing constructive and proactive feedback.

Risk Identification and Escalation

  • Ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policies, and procedures to certify relevant key codes as required.  Complete mandatory required training in a timely manner.  
  • Awareness of Moody’s risk management approach.
  • Increase awareness of cyber risks and avoidance of vulnerabilities e.g., e-mail use (phishing malware).
  • Ensure high quality of work free errors.

Qualifications

    • Minimum undergraduate/first-level degree (e.g. Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent qualifications) with strong academic performance (in the US, minimum GPA of 3.0).
    • Some relevant experience (including internships) is preferred.
    • Excellent verbal, written communication, and interpersonal skills.
    • Proficient in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
    • Proactive and able to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
    • Strong organization skills, analytical thinking, and attention to detail.
    • Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize tasks accordingly.
    • Some understanding of fixed income markets and/or credit knowledge is preferred.

 

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, place of origin, disability, marital or familial status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from Aboriginal persons, members of a visible minority group, persons with a disability, members of the LGBTQ+ community, and women.

Moody’s is committed to maintaining an inclusive, diverse and accessible workplace. To this end, reasonable accommodations are available on request, and will take into account the particular accommodation needs of individual candidates. If you are selected and require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, you may send your request to AODA@moodys.com. Information provided during the accommodation process will be treated as confidential, and will be shared only to the extent required to properly evaluate accommodation requests.

As a RM, you will be expected to find new opportunities within the strategic account(s) assigned, direct other sales reps, and lead contract negotiations on behalf of Moody’s Analytics. You are responsible for overall account management within a defined portfolio of clients and you will be expecting to work closely with the counterpart in other region to ensure a cohesive and strategic planning of the account as a whole.  Strategic accounts consist of some of the largest Tier 1 foreign banks, Asset Managers, insurance agencies & Corporate.  RMs are responsible for retaining and growing existing revenue streams with a strong focus on cross-selling and upselling the Moody’s Analytics suite of solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Grow relationships strategically covering a defined portfolio with senior client stakeholders at Board and C Suite-Level.
  • Convey the Moody’s Analytics value proposition, and deliver on sales targets for both new and recurring revenue through a combination of:
    •  Excellent C-level relationship & client engagement

    •  Selling new products and solutions
    • Re-inforce value proposition to retain and grow client relationships
    • Significant meeting activities
    •  Leading, advancing, and negotiating sales to closing
  • Maintain high level of product knowledge
  • Gain and maintain familiarity with client organization and processes to help direct them towards the appropriate Moody’s solution set
  • Manage sales cycles using coordination and communication skills to involve sales specialist where appropriate
  • Provide current forecasts and pipeline information to management
  • Introduce leads to other business units where appropriate

 

Qualifications :

  • Minimum 10 years of sales and/or relationship management experience, preferably within the financial services sector. Have local markets knowledge and senior stakeholders connections in APAC countries.
  • Proven track record of sales capability
  • A credit or capital markets background would be preferred but not required
  • Experience working within or selling into financial institution. Solid demonstrated understanding of the financial institution
  • Ability to identify opportunities to cross-sell Moody’s products and solutions
  • Ability to sell on a needs/solutions approach
  • Ability to close deals effectively in a timely manner
  • Ability to work independently while also demonstrating excellent team-working skills
  • High level of commitment
  • Excellent communication skills, including listening skills
  • Excellent senior client stakeholders relationship building, inter-personal and organizational skills are a prerequisite
  • Planning and organizational skills
  • Willingness to travel within assigned region approximately 30% of the time.

Role/Responsibilities

  • Moody’s Analytics (MA) seeks a highly qualified Assistant General Counsel to work with our Strategic Accounts Sales Team in the Americas.  The Assistant General Counsel position, which reports into the MA Senior Assistant General Counsel, presents an opportunity to provide business-critical professional services to our largest and growing customer segment of the company.  
     
  • The Assistant General Counsel position may also handle drafting and negotiating commercial transactions such as license, subscription and services agreements with MA’s sophisticated customer base (including a diverse range of US and Canadian banks, brokers, insurers and large corporates and governments) and possibly some management responsibilities.
  • Responsibilities will include:
  • Conducting all aspects of contract drafting and lead negotiations concerning software and data licenses, SaaS product subscriptions and related service level agreements, maintenance agreements, RFPs, professional services agreements and alliance partner/subcontractor agreements, while providing support to the relevant regional MA sales and services organizations in a broad range of commercial transactions.
  • Supporting and carrying out MA’s business policies and practices, including preferred contract terms and compromise positions; gaining familiarity with and observing compliance policies such as anti-bribery, economic and trade sanctions and competition law policies; navigating privacy and information security issues relating to MA’s SaaS and cloud-based products; and observing MA’s revenue recognition policies in the preparation and conclusion of contracts.  The successful candidate must also have the ability to explain these policies and procedures clearly to others.
  • As appropriate, working closely with outside counsel and with many of the company’s other in-house lawyers, sales operations and finance staff, as well as product, support and delivery teams in the lines of business.
  • Navigating customer bureaucracies and working to effectively close deals in a timely manner on acceptable terms to MA.
  • Answering questions and offering professional legal advice on a wide range of issues
  • Managing and streamlining internal processes.  We value employees who exercise initiative and display creativity in solving challenges and accomplishing business objectives.

Required Qualifications

  • Law degree from top tier law school
  • Member of a state bar in good standing
  • 12+ years total legal experience, of which: (i) at least 3 years of which are in a law firm, IP licensing/tech transactions, corporate, securities, capital markets, financial services, M&A or other transactional based work; and (ii) the remaining years of experience are either with a law firm or with an in-house legal team, preferably with a technology, professional services or financial services company and with managerial responsibilities
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, and a strong team orientation; ability to communicate confidently with senior management on complex legal and contractual issues
  • Strong analytical and writing skills
  • Strong contract drafting and negotiation skills and a sound understanding of various types of software licensing and services transactions, subscription-based business models and familiarity with software revenue recognition principles
  • Experience in banking and financial services or a technology / software company is a strong plus, as are candidates who have a background dealing with government contracts.
  • Hard working, well organized, detail-oriented and process-driven candidates who have a demonstrated ability to manage a diverse workload under demanding deadline pressures

 

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong managerial experience with a background in software licensing agreements and familiarity with local, state and federal government contracts.

At Moody’s Analytics KYC OU, we have the most extensive company and corporate structure information combined with sanctions and other adverse data on third parties, and the individuals behind them. We help customers effectively assess, screen, and monitor the individuals and companies they do business with. We provide best-in-class tools and data, empowering our customers to understand the risks associated with their customers, suppliers, and extended network

Our customers range from the biggest global banks to small fintech start-ups and our data helps to minimize their reputational risk exposure.

We are a team made up of dedicated project managers, implementation specialists and product strategists, who are all passionate about understanding and meeting our customers’ business needs.

As part of the Solutions Delivery team, the PM will be the face of the company and the owner of project health for complex customer implementations. In implementing our KYC products, you will work alongside our pre-sales and implementation teams to scope, manage, deliver and present to customer stakeholders.

 

Core Responsibilities:

The Project Manager is responsible for organizing, tracking and bringing client implementation projects to a successful, timely completion.

The role will require coordinating/leading a sizeable cross-functional team that includes relationship managers, solutions specialists, KYC domain specialists as well as implementation specialists, customer success managers and product managers. This is an external facing role which will also require managing external stakeholders and their KYC implementation needs. As a PM, you will:

  • Be the face of Moody’s KYC OU for assigned projects and demonstrate the values and capabilities aligned with the expectations set to our customers.
  • Act as the primary point of contact for assigned projects with customers, management, sales, product and the wider Solutions Delivery team
  • Ensure customer satisfaction through organised, consistent professionalism
  • Manage a portfolio of projects including ownership of governance, reporting, contributing to building standard approaches, documentation of requirements, maintaining customer documentation and the onboarding plan
  • Develop an actionable project plan, get “buy-in” from key stakeholders and drive the project to completion. The project plan will be based on an already established implementation process which will require communication to ensure follow through
  • Communicate and acquire client sign off on project documentation as identified as part of the implementation process (e.g. scoping statements, configuration documents, etc.)
  • Investigate, diagnose and help resolve issues that impede the project from moving forward
  • Update internal project tracker to ensure each implementation stage is recorded
  • Update senior management and group leaders on the status of complex implementations, as required

 

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 3 years related project management experience (project management qualification desired)
  • Familiarity with compliance subjects (e.g. KYC, AML, ABC, Sanctions and PEPs). AML qualification desired but not required
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Exceptional organizational and planning ability
  • Strong attention to detail in all aspects of planning and execution
  • Process oriented mind-set with a demonstrated history of achievements
  • Ability to logically identify the root cause of problems and get to resolution quickly and efficiently
  • Familiarity with the Agile approach, project management software and Microsoft suite of tools is recommended
  • Must have a minimum of a bachelor’s degree or demonstrate the equivalent of relevant work experience 
  • Spanish Speaking desired but not required

We are looking for a technically proficient and customer-focused Technical
Consultant to join the Know Your Customer (KYC) Solutions Delivery Team. The
Technical Consultant will be responsible for gaining an understanding of the system
specifications and capabilities of MA’s KYC products, so that customers experience a
top-notch implementation and access to world class ongoing technical assistance.
They will work closely with Implementation Specialists and Project Managers on the
KYC Solutions Delivery team to ensure clients are integrated and implemented as
seamlessly as possible with their purchased solution(s)


Key Responsibilities:

  •  Improving system efficiency by consulting with end-users and providing innovative solutions
  •  Maintenance and improvement of Solutions Delivery technical documentation, including updating existing manuals and guides, as well as creating new documentation to reflect changes or additions to our systems and processes.
  • Work with Implementation Specialists and Project Managers for new implementations/existing client change requests.
  •  Point of escalation for support tickets via a dedicated queue for customer queries relating to workflow tools, and triaging when necessary to other relevant teams within the KYC OU.
  •  Collaborate with Product teams to ensure the Solutions Delivery team has documented processes for any new products, releases, and upgrades.
  • Work closely with other internal stakeholders on the fulfilment, support, engineering, and operations teams.
  • Joining implementation/project calls to provide product expertise, as required

Experience/Qualifications:

 

  • A bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, information systems, computer engineering, or similar.
  • Strong knowledge of scripting (Python or other object orientated language) and API integrations (RESTful API)
  • Proficiency in providing efficient web-portal support.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, both internally and externally.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Agile and ability to learn new products & processes closely
  • Project management experience a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities:

An associate engineer whose primary responsibility is to provide client support and address client needs in the structured finance sector. Responsibilities include:

  • Analyze complex structured finance cash flow models.
  • Provide client support and resolve client requests.
  • Update complex structured finance cash flow models over the performance cycle with accuracy and within the required turnaround time.
  • Ensure the accuracy of data feeding the Cash flow models in deal library.
  • Coordinate with the product development team to design, build test and implement new features.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally within the organization.
  • Assist with special projects.

Qualifications:

  • Masters Degree in Finance with a quantitative background at Undergrad/Bachelors level.
  • CFA/FRM certified is a plus
  • 1-2 years working experience, preferably in fixed income space
  • Meticulous attention to detail, outstanding organizational abilities, and strong analytical skills, with the capacity to handle multiple projects concurrently.
  • Familiarity with structured finance cash flow models and data is desirable. Also, highly preferable to have practical knowledge in at least one of the structured finance asset classes, CDO, CLO, ABS, SLABS, or RMBS.
  • Proficient or expert level skills in Excel, VBA, SQL, Python is a plus.
  • Familiarity with additional programming/scripting languages is beneficial
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Should have a self-learning attitude.
  • Demonstrated initiative, enthusiasm, and ability to learn quickly and excel as part of a dynamic team.

Team/Department Description :
The Data Solutions division is the commercial data business of Moody’s Analytics, bringing together a vast catalogue of data to help business decision-makers assess risks and opportunities. We are best known for Orbis, the world’s most comprehensive database of public and private companies. We are also the definitive source of ratings-related data for companies and securities that have been rated by Moody’s Investors Service. We strive to deliver convenience and insight to our customers by eliminating the hassle of sourcing, preparing and accessing data, adding value when decisions need to be made. Role/Responsibilities :

  • Work within an agile team environment to perform software verification activities. Design, develop, drive and deliver high-level test strategies, methodologies and take a hands-on approach to see that they are implemented timely and efficiently. 
  • Execute and maintain the automated test scripts, assuring continuous testing process.
  • Execute manual test cases, including ad-hoc and exploratory testing as needed.
  • Document and/or review testing results working closely with developers and product owners to resolve reported issues.
  • Implement CI/CD using by integrating Automation builds in Development Pipelines.
  • Show strong expertise in reproducing, analysing and finding the root cause for clients' issues.
  • Work in an agile environment, helping improve process and define QA best practices.

Qualifications :

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a closely related field.
  • 3+ years of QA experience.
  • Experience in exploratory testing techniques, or other Agile QA methodologies.
  • Knowledge of various software testing methods (Regression, Load/Stress, Code Coverage Analysis, Acceptance, Performance)
  • Ability to work in an Agile team environment and handle changing priorities.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects, work under pressure and tight deadlines, and work independently.
  • Ability to communicate with and present to engineers, senior management and relevant stakeholders.
  • Experience with test automation tools (Selenium, Pytest, Playwright or similar).
  • Strong SQL skills.
  • Experience or exposure to AWS cloud services (S3, Athena, DynamoDB, Lambdas, Step Functions, Glue Jobs…) and cloud data warehouses (Snowflake).
  • Experience with distributed source control systems (Git).
  • Coding skills with Python programming language would be treated as an advantage.
  • Experience in Data testing and ETL testing is preferred.

Please, submit your CV in English

The Role:

The Senior Financial Data Analyst performs a range of financial data, analytical and research services that contribute to the overall credit analysis function performed by the Corporate Finance or Infrastructure rating groups. Prospective candidates will have a good understanding of fundamental finance and financial statements as well as a basic understanding of capital markets. The ideal candidate for this role will possess strong organizational skills, demonstrate attention to detail as well as their ability to work effectively individually and in a collaborative team environment.

Being part of the Data & Analytics function provides a unique opportunity to foster skills that are valuable to any future career in the financial services industry. This will be an internally facing role, reporting into the team manager.

Responsibilities:

 

•             Analyzing financial statements and making necessary adjustments

•             Reviewing financial ratios to identify trends or significant changes

•             Working directly with analysts to discuss the data, adjustments and other information needed by the rating team for ratings and research

•             Process improvement: utilizing expertise to identify inefficiencies, suggest improvements, build consensus and implement the change

•             Lead projects to improve data quality and other internal processes

•             Liaising with rating analysts and knowledge managers in knowledge sharing and training sessions and with outsourcers and other colleagues providing training and feedback

 

Qualifications:

 

•             Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent qualification in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business administration preferred

•             Accounting background with strong focus in financial analysis (e.g., through coursework or relevant work experience) would be an advantage

•             Strong English language skills

•             French, German, Italian language (reading skills are especially important, strong writing and speaking skills are not required) is considered an advantage

•             Good knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint is considered as an advantage

•             Solid verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills

•             Strong organizational skills, with ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize tasks accordingly

•             Attention to detail and commitment to produce high quality, accurate work

•             Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environmen

Annual base salary gross: € 24,800 - 39,600. Applicable to Lithuania candidates: The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Moody’s salary range for this position.
